recordings.type: adult, begging call, call, hatchling or nestling
recordings.rmk:
Grey Herons in a heronry. The recording follows XC669640. Please see XC669637 for details about the breeding colony here.

Recorded with home made SASS and Olympus LS-12. EQ adjusted below 150 Hz to remove a little background rumble and light editing in a few places to remove some distant road noise below 200 Hz.

recordings.type: adult, begging call, call, hatchling or nestling
recordings.rmk:
Grey Herons in a heronry. The recording follows XC669637. Please see that recording for details about the breeding colony here.

Recorded with home made SASS and Olympus LS-12. EQ adjusted below 150 Hz to remove a little background rumble and light editing in a few places to remove some distant road noise below 250 Hz..

recordings.type: adult, begging call, call, hatchling or nestling
recordings.rmk:
Grey Herons in a heronry. The recording follows XC669636. I counted 22 nests with at least 10 occupied. The nests are spread along this linear woodland covering around 100m from end to end. 

I could see one young one had already hatched and in fact looked fairly large. There were at least two making the incessant begging calls that are heard throughout. The adults often left the nests with a loud honk call (e.g. 16:10) but also made other calls such as the guttural sound at the beginning when arriving at the nest. I guess this was as they bring back food but I did not visually confirm this. 

Recorded with home made SASS and Olympus LS-12. EQ adjusted below 150 Hz to remove a little background rumble and below 600 Hz in a few places to remove light vehicle noise.

recordings.loc: Wäldchen b. Grünsink (near  Hofstetten), Landsberg am Lech, Oberbayern, Bayern
recordings.type: begging call, call, female, flight call, juvenile, male, social calls, threat ca
recordings.file-name: XC377398-GRAUREIHERkolonie, ad. u.  Nestl.    11.06.2017  (corr.)  Grünsink  6_21 - 6_31  gek..mp3
recordings.rmk: A little colony of probably 9 nests in a small field wood just behind the plots of a little settlement. The nests are nearly unvisible, built in high tight pines. Beside the begging calls of the nestlings there are several gurgling and shrieking calls of the adults, more or less excited, flight calls and maybe threat calls. Same scenario as in XC261369 and  preveous and following recordings

recordings.rmk:
A little colony (maybe at least 6 nests) in a small field wood just behind the plots of a little settlement. The nests are nearly unvisible, built in high tight pines.
Beside the begging calls of the nestlings there are several gurgling and shrieking calls of the adults, more or less excited, fly calls at the end of the recording and, as I guess, typical threat calls from 3:00.
Equipment: Directional mikrofone Rode NTG-3 and fieldrecorder Olympus LS-100.

recordings.loc: Pimlico Sand, River Severn, Arlingham, Gloucestershire, England
recordings.rmk:
A Grey Heron calling in indignation at my presence. As it flew off over the River Severn it made this series of five calls (two typical "rrakk" calls followed by three quieter and deeper calls).

Recorded on a misty but mild day with an Olympus LS-12 and Sennheiser ME66 handheld. Edited lightly to remove a little high pitched rustling but only before the first vocalisation.

**Comments**: None.

**Recording modifications**: No edits. Recorded using Olympus LS-P1.

**Habitat (inc. vegetation and level)**: Mountain pass, bird flying above.

**Behaviour**: Bird calling while flying south.

**Sex (with ID cues)**: None.

**Weather and other conditions**: Cloudy evening.

**Comments on other birds**: None.

recordings.type: call, life stage uncertain, sex uncertain
recordings.rmk:
near a little pond at the edge of farmfields..to mixed forest  ---  sound was trapped - ..for 2 1/2 days

**therefor the analyze of the species isn't shure...cause NO BIRD SEEN** .

date/time **now: Saturday 10.11.2018 --1,00 p.m.-4,00 p.m.MEZ** .

place: ( KusaWoiMittlLOF1-µµ-1 )

place: ((( weiherWWNerdbeerfelAmO-ufer1 ))).

**here:**   

... in this group-upload-till-now, i have to correct me here .. **because of the told exact recording place here** -- the recorder **is not direct at the pond** installed ... **but 'nearby a little drainage ditch' 40-70 m north of the pond**.

.....so **now:** .. [the drainage-ditch-place-1  is here to hear](https://www.xeno-canto.org/explore?query=rec%3A+uhl+year%3A+2018+month%3A+11+rmk%3A+foresty+loc%3A+bobingen+rmk%3A%3Dlaying&pg=1) 

-- & now the  [corrected drainage-ditch-place-1 is also here to hear](https://www.xeno-canto.org/explore?query=rec%3A%20uhl%20year%3A%202018%20month%3A%2011%20loc%3A%20bobingen%20rmk%3A%20KusaWoiMittlLOF1-µµ-1%20) .  

---  you hear in background allways the water of the little ditch, nearby my at a bush fastened 'tascam dr-08'.

also must be said: during these days here **the wind was pretty strong** .

acustic-noise-pollution is in these IDs: -- traffic -- **the water-sound of the little ditch** -- vistitors of this area -- aircrafts -- traffic -- foresty worker ... **and allways a strong wind, too** .

.. so sorry for the troubles, but i made in november-december 2018 at this pond several different "sound-was trapped tasks" ...each lasting 2-3 days with my recorders.  ...- i couldn't remind exact the datas here...uploading these files now 2 years later.
